title: How to Create a Photographic Portfolio With Your Flickr Images With Pullfolio

steps.headline: Go to Pullfolio.com.
steps.description: You will immediately see what Pullfolio can do for you; both with the free level and pro level. Yes, they even have an iPhone app!

steps.headline: Click on 'Sign up'.
steps.description: This will take you to the page to create an account.

steps.headline: Link to your Flickr account.
Add a new portfolio by clicking on Add New.
steps.description: Since this is your first time, there won't be anything there yet.

steps.headline: Create the portfolio by filling in the required information.
steps.description: While there is an option for a password, you don't have to use it. If you are a professional who will be selling your portraits, you might want to consider it.

steps.headline: Organize your Flickr images.
steps.description: This will enable them to show up in Pullfolio. You can organize them by tags or by photosets. Photosets will allow you to be more sure of what shows up. Depending on the number of images that you have, you will probably lose track of what is tagged with what.

steps.headline: Be sure that whatever you chose, you have set when you created the portfolio.
steps.description: If you are unsure, click on 'Edit'. When you choose 'Photoset', your sets will appear for you to choose from.

text:
Go to Pullfolio.com. You will immediately see what Pullfolio can do for you; both with the free level and pro level. Yes, they even have an iPhone app! Click on 'Sign up'. This will take you to the page to create an account. Link to your Flickr account. You will need to do this so that it can access your images. Click the 'Continue' button at the bottom of the page. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Create-a-Photographic-Portfolio-With-Your-Flickr-Images-With-Pullfolio-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Create-a-Photographic-Portfolio-With-Your-Flickr-Images-With-Pullfolio-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/28/Create-a-Photographic-Portfolio-With-Your-Flickr-Images-With-Pullfolio-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.0439560439561,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Click 'OK, I'll Authorize It'. If you have never done this before with another site, you might want to read this and make sure that it is ok.{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Create-a-Photographic-Portfolio-With-Your-Flickr-Images-With-Pullfolio-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Create-a-Photographic-Portfolio-With-Your-Flickr-Images-With-Pullfolio-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b0/Create-a-Photographic-Portfolio-With-Your-Flickr-Images-With-Pullfolio-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.0439560439561,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add a new portfolio by clicking on Add New. Since this is your first time, there won't be anything there yet. Create the portfolio by filling in the required information. While there is an option for a password, you don't have to use it. If you are a professional who will be selling your portraits, you might want to consider it. Organize your Flickr images. This will enable them to show up in Pullfolio. You can organize them by tags or by photosets. Photosets will allow you to be more sure of what shows up. Depending on the number of images that you have, you will probably lose track of what is tagged with what. Be sure that whatever you chose, you have set when you created the portfolio. If you are unsure, click on 'Edit'. When you choose 'Photoset', your sets will appear for you to choose from.
